t: What an Amazon Breakup Would Look Like and Why It's a Win for Brands
s: October 22, 2022 - Amazon is on the brink of a possible breakup, and marketers should be ready to seize the opportunity. It's difficult to imagine life without Amazon -- as we know it. But with ongoing antitrust probes by Congress, there's a real possibility that Amazon's e-commerce dominance may soon end.

t: Nike vs. Amazon: The Breakup That Changed E-Commerce
s: December 10, 2024 - Amazon: The Breakup That Changed E-Commerce ... In 2017, Nike made headlines by partnering with Amazon, selling its products directly through the e-commerce giant. This move aimed to crack down on counterfeit products, control brand representation, and tap into Amazon’s massive customer base.

s: January 27, 2023 - Given the colossal growth of Amazon in recent years, it is surprising to see a big brand like Nike moving away from it. t: Amazon defies break-up wave sweeping conglomerates | Reuters
s: February 22, 2022 - Feb 22 (Reuters) - Amazon.com Inc has become the poster child of technology giants bucking the trend of major conglomerates breaking up, thanks to bright growth prospects shielding it from pressure to follow suit, investors and dealmakers said.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 5 hours ago - Amazon opened its tenth physical bookstore in 2017; media speculation at the time suggested that Amazon planned to eventually roll out 300 to 400 bookstores around the country. All of its locations were closed in 2022 along with other retail locations under the "Amazon 4-Star" brand.

t: FTC Sues Amazon for Illegally Maintaining Monopoly Power | Federal Trade Commission
s: December 5, 2023 - The Federal Trade Commission and 17 state attorneys general today sued Amazon.com, Inc. alleging that the online retail and technology company is a monopolist that uses a set of interlocking anticompetitive and unfair strategies to illegally maintain its monopoly power.
